m9.description: The predicted human attention on different design classes and natural images, visualized as a heatmap and heatmap overlay.

m10.name: WAVE (Weighted Affective Valence Estimates)
m10.description: The mean of a mapping of pixel colors to the color preference values.

m11.name: Static clusters
m11.description: The number of static 32-sized color clusters; only clusters with more than five values are counted.

m12.name: Dynamic clusters
m12.description: The number of dynamic color clusters after color reduction; only RGB values covering more than five pixels are counted. If a difference between two colors in a color cube is less than or equal to three, two colors are united in the same cluster, which continues recursively for all colors.

m13.description: The standard deviation of pixel luminance.

m14.description: LAB color space average and standard deviation.

m18.description: The predicted technical and aesthetic qualities of images.

m19.description: The ratio of distinct RGB values to the number of dynamic clusters.

m20.name: Color harmony
m20.description: The closest harmonic color scheme and distance to it.

references.title: Cohen-Or, D., Sorkine, O., Gal, R., Leyvand, T., and Xu, Y.Q. (2006). Color Harmonization. ACM Transactions on Graphics, 25(3), 624-630. doi: https://doi.org/10.1145/1141911.1141933

results.name: Distance to the closest harmonic template
Harmonized image
results.description: Harmonized image based on the closest harmonic template with minimal changes.

results.name: Source and target hues
results.description: The hue histogram of the image before and after harmonization.

m21.name: Grid quality
m21.description: Grid quality indicates the internal alignment of the various components or identifiable regions of the GUI with respect to each other.

references.title: Miniukovich, A. and De Angeli, A. (2015). Computation of Interface Aesthetics. In Proceedings of the 33rd Annual ACM Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI '15), pp. 1163-1172. ACM. doi: https://doi.org/10.1145/2702123.2702575

results.name: Number of visual GUI blocks - without children
Number of alignment points - without children
Number of block sizes - without children
Number of vertical block sizes - without children

m23.name: Color blindness
m23.description: A physiologically-based model for simulation of color vision deficiency.

references.title: Machado, G.M., Oliveira, M.M., and Fernandes, L.A.F. (2009). A Physiologically-based Model for Simulation of Color Vision Deficiency. IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics, 15(6), 1291-1298. doi: https://doi.org/10.1109/TVCG.2009.113

results.name: Protanopia
results.description: Red-green color blindness, lack of Long-wavelength (L, ~red) cone cells in the retina

results.name: Deuteranopia
results.description: Red-green color blindness, lack of Medium-wavelength (M, ~green) cone cells in the retina

results.name: Tritanopia
results.description: Blue-yellow color blindness, lack of Short-wavelength (S, ~blue) cone cells in the retina

m24.name: AIM legacy segmentation
m24.description: A GUI element detection tool based on computer vision.

references.title: Oulasvirta, A., De Pascale, S., Koch, J., Langerak, T., Jokinen, J.P.P., Todi, K., Laine, M., Kristhombuge, M., Zhu, Y., Miniukovich, A., Palmas, G., and Weinkauf, T. (2018). In Proceedings of the 31st Annual ACM Symposium on User Interface Software and Technology (UIST'18 Adjunct), pp. 16-19. ACM. doi: https://doi.org/10.1145/3266037.3266087

m25.name: UIED segmentation
m25.description: A GUI element detection toolkit that leverages old-fashioned computer vision algorithms for non-text region extraction, and deep learning models to perform classifications and text detection.

references.title: Xie, M., Feng, S., Xing, Z., Chen, J., and Chen, C. (2020). UIED: A Hybrid Tool for GUI Element Detection. In Proceedings of the 28th ACM Joint Meeting on European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (ESEC/FSE '20), pp. 1655-1659. ACM. doi: https://doi.org/10.1145/3368089.3417940

Chen, J., Xie, M., Xing, Z., Chen, C., Xu, X., Zhu, L., and Li, G. (2020). Object Detection for Graphical User Interface: Old Fashioned or Deep Learning or a Combination? In Proceedings of the 28th ACM Joint Meeting on European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (ESEC/FSE '20), pp. 1202-1214. ACM. doi: https://doi.org/10.1145/3368089.3409691

m27.name: Quadtree decomposition
m27.description: Quadtree decomposition for 3 aesthetic dimensions including balance, symmetry, and equilibrium.

references.title: Ngo, D., Teo, L. and Byrne, J. (2003). Modelling interface aesthetics. Information Sciences 152, pp. 25-46. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/S0020-0255(02)00404-8

results.name: Quadtree blocks - color entropy based
results.description: Quadtree blocks of the image based on the shannon entropy comparison over colored image.

results.name: Quadtree blocks - gray std based
results.description: Quadtree blocks of the image based on standard deviation comparison over grayscale image.
